title: Student-Centered Pedagogical Approach for Understanding New Religious Movements

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of religion in general, foundational sociological approaches
context.additional_context: Providing flexible learning environments centered on online discussions and case analyses for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three historical and social contexts of new religious movements.
Learners can write a discussion essay critically analyzing the binary classification of "religion" and "cult."
Learners can submit a report that evaluates the social impact of new religious movements from multiple perspectives through case studies.

resources: LMS Platform (Discussion Board, Assignment Submission System)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
